item.body: I’ve recommended this to everyone. As a ski patroller, we practice Avy rescue scenarios, and this shovel is fantastic. It’s lightweight, has a D handle, and goes into hoe mode while being able to store flat, plus is cuts through firm snow quite well. Construction is ideal, having a welded collar for the shaft to slide into, and the shaft is oval, so when deploying the pins are lined up when extending. Excellent choice, and I’m unaware of a better one on the market. Lighter when it comes to rescue equipment is not the way to go, get a tool that will do the job well when it comes to saving your friend’s life.
item.title: Best Avy Shovel

item.body:
Have had multiple issues with these poles. The locking mechanism slips regularly and needs to be tightened often. The top section has pulled completely out of the locking mechanism multiple times leading to the whole bottom section of the pole falling out while skiing. A basket has also broken off in the 5 or so months that I've used them. 
When they work they're great and have a good grip but overall they're very underwhelming.
item.title: Poor quality

teamRelationships.teamName: United States Ski and Snowboard Association

item.body: Bought these skis for late spring touring, and they performed as advertised. Incredibly light paired with the Dynafit Speed Radical bindings, and made the uphill a breeze. I barely felt them on my pack for bootpacks to the summit. They can get a little squirrelly in variable snow conditions, and took me a minute to figure out that these skis like a more forward stance. With spring corn they skiied great, and the weight was appreciated navigating the tight trees back to the trailhead. For what they are designed for (long tours/ski mountaineering) this is a great set-up!
item.title: Great lightweight spring touring ski

item.body: It does everything you want a technical fleece to do. I mostly use it bc and resort skiing, it floats between being primary midlayer and the layer immediately above my baselayer. Long torso, long sleeves, correct collar size, cut for range of motion without bunching up under clothing, fits true to size. Also the klein blue color is just cool.
item.title: New favorite fleece

entityData.description: Men's Polartec Power Grid Half Zip Jacket

metadata.currentDescription: Men's Polartec Power Grid Half Zip Jacket

item.body: I went for the Climb 2.0.  I have found these to be easy on and off. I stuck to the side of the hill when I needed to and the glide was just right for me.  I don't need to race up the hill but I also don't take my time. In particular, I don't like to do more work than necessary and these skins suit my style well.  Right out of the great smelling box, I found that it was very easy to size these to my skis.  I can't speak too much to the durability since it was just one season of use and not many tours at that, but so far it seems like they will last a while.  Additionally, I have added these to my patrol pack since they don't take up too much extra space.
item.title: Performance as expected

item.body: Pumped to be able to get myself a pair of these at such a great price. ChromaPop lenses are the real deal, and these come with 2 different lenses! XL frames make sure no air gets in while skiing and creates fog. I will say to be careful when cleaning the inside of the lens because oils from your fingers can mess with the anti-fog. Lenses aren't super easy to change, but you get the hang of it after doing it a few times. If you're worried about that, pay a bit extra for the Mag versions.
item.title: Great Goggles

item.body: I first bought this hoodie in the non-zip version and loved it so much I bought a second with the full zip. Love the fit, supremely comfy, great colors, and it's super functional for outdoor activity. Rivals the Patagonia R1. I have used it on sub zero days all the way up to 40 degrees and it works for all. Super breathable even though the material feels thick. Hasn't been too hot during activity, and I've used it on runs, backcountry skis, or just hanging on the couch and it passes the test for all. Love it.
item.title: Perfect 4 season hoodie

entityData.description: Women's Mega Trail Mix Fleece Full Zip Hoodie

metadata.currentDescription: Women's Mega Trail Mix Fleece Full Zip Hoodie

item.body: I have been looking for an alternative to my Patagonia R1 and have never found anything I liked as much. This hoodie rivals the R1, with an even better fit and design. I love the comfy cut, the thumb holes, and the colors. I have used it on winter runs, backcountry ski days, and just hanging on the couch, and it passes the test for all. Though the material feels a bit thicker than the R1, it has been just as breathable and hasn't felt too warm during activity. I have already bought it in another color and have worn it tons!
item.title: Perfect 4 season hoodie

entityData.description: Women's Mega Trail Mix Fleece Pullover Hoodie

metadata.currentDescription: Women's Mega Trail Mix Fleece Pullover Hoodie

item.body:
I've always struggled to find snug helmets that don't crush my head when tightened. This is the answer to my dreams! It's super comfy, well-ventilated for warmer days, fits well with Oakley goggles, and gives me confidence on steeps and in the trees. The chin strap is easy to operate with gloves and I love the removeable ear pieces.

It took me a couple outing to find a vertical adjustment on the nape strap. It was a game changer once I got that dialed in. I almost forget I'm wearing it. So good, I put the whole family in it!
item.title: Fully featured helmet for my head shape

item.body: Great helmet that does what it needs to.  Kept me safe and comfortable in wind and blizzard conditions as well as warm spring days.  The vents are easy to manipulate with gloved hands, and the lining fits a thin skida comfortably.  Slight ear pressure when wearing glasses on longer days, but nothing that stops you from skiing.  Love me some hi-viz yellow too.
item.title: Mission accomplished

item.body: Skied most of the '23-24 season on these in Colorado's front range and west slope.  They've taken me through everything from double BD glades to easy groomers.  Ranger 96 is more intentional and demanding than a carbon ski like the Ripstick or Kore, and they ask for speed to make good carves on piste.  They crush icy groomers as well as the steeps and late season slush, and have given me great sidecountry performance with Salomon Shift bindings.  Would absolutely recommend for an intermediate skier looking to hone technique and open up new terrain.  Yellow is gorgeous too.  (5'11", 180lb, 173cm)
item.title: Awesome do-it-all ski

item.body: I've been using the Oakley EYEJACKET REDUX glasses on several ski tours and they've proven to be outstanding. Their surprising side protection effectively shields against wind, snow, and glare, maintaining excellent visibility under challenging conditions. The glasses stay securely in place, and the lenses provide exceptional clarity, crucial for navigating snowy landscapes. Perfect for any outdoor enthusiast, these glasses blend high functionality with style, enhancing both safety and skiing experience. Highly recommended for their robust performance and sleek design!
item.title: The Ultimate Casual & Ski Touring Shades

item.body:
This bag feels like it holds more than my 32L Camelback Trailblazer, might just be the organization between pockets but it holds a lot. Been using the Targhee pretty heavily (mostly full if not entirely @ max 25-30lbs) for 3-4 months now, no signs of tearing or unthreading at the seams. Stays tight during and after falls. Room for skis or snowboard when hiking. Only complaint is it didnt come with a bladder, fits my camelback 3.5L bladder pretty well.
(Airpods for scale)
item.title: Bigger than it looks

item.body: The Prizm Sage Gold Lens is simply an outstanding lens here in Colorado.  Dark enough for bright sunny days, but being a brown-ish base, helps add some contrast for the more cloudy/partly cloudy days.  Even when the sun goes away and it starts to snow, this lens works ok, but I'll probably add a hi-pink lens to the quiver next year for the snowy and super overcast days, as this lens is not really designed to be a super all-arounder.  Fit is on the larger side of medium fit, and the goggles integrate well with my Smith Vantage helmet.  No gapper gaps here!
item.title: Maximum View and Clarity

item.body: I purchased these for my Moment Wildcats that are mounted with a Pivot Cast system. These crampons performed exceptionally during my trip to Tahoe in early April. These brought me up some bulletproof morning sierra skinners that wouldn't have been possible without. They engage with the snow effortlessly and release without drag/catching. I was putting my full body weight on one side to hold an edge in steep ice and expected these to be all bent out of shape, but to my surprise they were good as new afterewards. Super impressed with the strength for the relatively light weight crampons. If you have a Pivot Cast you have no other options, and if you don't these are a fantastic option for you.
item.title: The Best Ski Crampons

item.body:
They appear like they might be too delicate to do anything- imagine a pair of thin tights-  but I found them  comfortable enough, not much compression to speak of. 
I happen to experience a slight itchiness from the materials, but they have been warm enough under my unlined shell ski pants. I like the ease of pulling them on after quick pit stops, and that they are not bulky. I do enjoy their color…But would I recommend? Probably not, especially if someone needs to pay full price.
item.title: Easy base layer

item.body: These skis are some excellent intermediate-advanced all mountain skis. They happen to do anything you want decently well, whether it's floating in fresh powder (surprisingly, even deep powder is doable), carving hard groomers, or playing in slush. I would say they're not as playful as some skis, and might not be as forgiving for beginners as others could be, but they're also not difficult to ride. Anyone could pick these up and enjoy a day of skiing in any condition.
item.title: Liberty Origin 96

item.body: These bibs are an excellent shell. Starting with the sizing, I used the the guide and they fit perfectly. I am a skier averaging 50 days a season.  On most days this winter on the east coast, the shell with a merino wool base layer was sufficient. In the colder days, (single digits) and on race days where I stood in the side of the mountain for hours hand timing or just watching my son’s races,  I actually swapped these out for an older pair of insulated pants. The real test came on a rainy day. At first, it seemed like the shell was getting saturated because the water wasn’t beading and seemed to be soaking in. But after HOURS of skiing out in the rain, I was still dry! I was truly impressed with the performance of these pants (and jacket)!
item.title: Great bibs

teamRelationships.teamName: United States Ski and Snowboard Association

item.body: So at first when I got it I wasn’t sure how much I trusted the sucking power of the suction cups but they held both of my bikes with no issues at all. The system was super easy to install and take off of my car. The only problem I experienced with the bomber was that one of the pumps for one of the cups broke in the second day of use and I have no clue why but they ship an extra pump in the box so I replaced it and everything now seems to work fine just a little inconvenient. But great product over all would totally recommend.
item.title: Great product and easy to work with. Only had one small issue

item.body: I've done rides from 8 miles to 50 miles in these and they have held up great. The orbit blue color is gorgeous. I have no issue with the grip or fit, I can even use these without an undershirt and I don't experience any discomfort. I don't think I would take these on anything longer than 50 miles but I am always impressed by these workhorses.
item.title: Fast Shorts

item.body: The only reason this doesn't score 5/5 is the breathability. It's not something you notice until you try on other jerseys. I like that it doesn't have a crazy tight fit. The zipper gets a little sticky because of the logo but is not an issue during a ride. As a beginner in the sport, this is a great entry jersey.
item.title: Solid Jersey

item.body: I initially loved the rail sunglasses from Tifosi. I think this is going on my 3-4th pair of Tifosi glasses. they have a decent quality build for the price so I consider them a value brand. They offer good accessories like cleaning bags, additional lenses and a hard case if that is your preferred storage method. Where I feel like the glasses fall short is the longevity. I typically wear them 3-4 times a week cycling and they get dirt and sweat on them. I find my coating scratching easier than I would like compared to other brands I have had. I also find the soft arms start deteriorating quickly when exposed to sweat. So overall, in my experience I believe these to be squarely land on the budget side of things and if you are looking for something that you will get a longer life or more advanced features, look elsewhere.
item.title: Starts strong, limited lifespan

item.body: Le bundle Garmin 840 est le parfait upgrade pour remplacer mon ancien ordi de bord pour vélo. La prise en main est facile et rapide. Les sensors des appareils dans le bundle étaient déjà connectés à l'appareil, ce qui est plus, car tu ça facilite la prise en main. L'écran tactile fonctionne très bien ainsi que les divers boutons sur l'appareil garmin. Les données affichées sont visibles facilement sur l'écran et la navigation entre les pages est fluide. Je recommande sans hésiter ce produit pour le vélo de route et de gravel.
item.title: Ce qui me fallait

item.body: Great cycling computer- Fixed bar mount that comes with the computer is super nice and sturdy. More accurate then my other tracking methods (cell phone / smart watch) Love the feature that counts jumps and tracks airtime- super fun to look at after a ride! I'd have given it a 10 if the UI was a bit more intuitive
item.title: Garmin - Edge 530

item.body:
I've had these shorts for about a year and they've held up well to several months of daily riding, mountain and fixie. A lot of my pants don't survive more than a few rides but the crotch gusset and reinforcement are doing their job so far.

They've been on many 100+F rides and they breathe well and dry quickly. 

My only complaint is that the pocket liners aren't super robust and a small hole is starting to form in the stitching of the two panels of the front pocket that I keep my phone in. It is double stitched though so no worries about anything falling out yet. A zippered pocket would be nice as well, the pockets here aren't very secure during rides.

The clever engineering in this tool is astounding. My go to bikepacking sled is a Santa Cruz - Tallboy with a glove compartment. This pump is perfect to fit right in it and ridiculously light weight. What’s additionally exceptional is how each component collapses in on itself while being modular. The klic system is amazingly efficient for a magnetic system. The built in gauge is awesome for when you’re out on the trail.
item.title: Genius

item.body: I love these rims.  I have them installed on my Santa Cruz Tallboy and they have held up to serious beatings.  Purchased here on Expertvoice and laced to old DTSwiss hubs that i had from a previous bike. I typically ran 15PSI front and 18 rear with no cushcore and Schwalbe Big Betty Rear and Magic Mary Front.  I've ridden on these wheels for 2.5years now and only recently have had to true the wheels.  I had one instance that truly showed me how tough these wheels are when I made a mad dash downhill to escape a lightning storm and was bouncing off of granite rocks. I had a pinch flat in the tread caused by a rock and my rim. the rim is bent inward in several places but I never lost the  capability for a tubeless seal.
item.title: tough

item.body:
These gloves give great support and shock absorption.  These are my go-to gloves when I'm riding my road bike or when I'm on a less technical Mountain Bike Ride, for more technical I switch to the full finger version.

I love the velco/hook & loop connection on the back to allow easier putting on and taking off of the gloves.  The microfiber on the thumb does a great job of wiping sweat away from your face or brow.

All around a great glove.
item.title: NICA Coach

item.body:
Garmin knocked it out of the park with this unit. I got the bundle instead of the solar unit. I’ve used it 10 times or so since purchasing. I still have yet to charge it. Take the time to learn the interface. Once you overcome the learning curve, you have an incredible navigational ecosystem.

Downloading Komoot and Trailforks right to the unit is amazing. Garmin opened their API integration, meaning routes from your favorite trails are right on your unit. 

Furthermore, and perhaps just a luxury item, music control integration is amazing because the screen works soooooo well with gloves. I do some IMBA epics and all day bikepacking. I love to have my Aftershockz in and they don’t have good controls. This conquers that.
item.title: Such great integration

item.body: I've been using these a lot for my early-season riding instead of shorts.  These pants do not feel like long pants for some reason.  These have a magical combination of thin material, toughness, tapered legs, and stretch that makes them completely comfortable.   They don't get hung up on the saddle during technical descents, and the legs taper down in a stretch way toward the ankles that I really like.  A friend asked me about them wondering if they would eventually get too hot to wear in warmer weather and I told him that I could probably ride all summer in these because they have breathable vents and they feel so light.  And they're tough even though they feel light.  I'm sure that hard crashes would not harm or damage these pants.  I am 6' 2" and got a size medium.  It fits pretty well, but the waste is a bit low and I'm wondering if a large might be better.
item.title: Great Long Legs Riding Pants

item.body: I got a Klunker in the Corona colors. Its a hoot to pedal around the neighborhood. No gears and coaster brake for "cool" skids. (I'm old, my kids tell me I'm never cool.) This the bike to head out to the beer garden or a neighbor's house for some adult beverages. The bottle opener on the frame makes it even more fun.
item.title: If you're looking to cruise around your neighborbood on a bike

entityData.description: State Bicycle Co. x Corona - Klunker (27.5")

metadata.currentDescription: State Bicycle Co. x Corona - Klunker (27.5")

item.body: I'm a year-round bike commuter and went through many different methods of hauling my clothes and supplies to work. These have become my final and best solution. Waterproof for those wet commutes. Locking attachments point keep the bag on the rack even over the roughest city streets. I went with bright yellow for lots of visibility.
item.title: Best Panniers

item.body: It's a steel framed bike with a weight capacity of 300lbs. You can go base model or get upgrades... I got suspension fork, disk brakes, and both size wheels. If I did it again I would just get the 700 wheels, as that seems to be a good "do it all" size with lots of tire options. It does pop out of gear a bit, probably needs some adjustment. The hydraulic cable actuated brakes are not as nice as my sons full hydraulic brakes on a low end Trek MTB he has, but they are not bad either. It's a great price for a bike that really can get you out there with the big boys, not a Walmart bike. It's not gonna get ooohs and aaahs, but it's a solid bike and I wouldn't hesitate to buy it again if I had to do it all over again.
item.title: Great prices, works good for larger riders too

item.body: Great taste, and I don't typical like lemonade things, but that extra tanginess when you're working hard and in hot weather really helps. The texture is better than some chews (I don't care for Honey Stinger or Cliff chews) but my kids have found that they can get a little slippery if you don't chew them up right away and have drop some out of their mouths while riding but that's more of a kids problem. Seems to supply me with good fueling during long rides, combined with water/electrolytes and rotating with gels. No bonking!
item.title: Quickly became a favorite

entityData.description: PROBAR BOLT - Organic Energy Chews - Pink Lemonade

metadata.currentDescription: PROBAR BOLT - Organic Energy Chews - Pink Lemonade

item.body: I used this trailer to commute to and from school, about a mile in each direction. I volunteered as an EMT at the time and would have to carry multiple changes of clothes and well as tools and books for my classes. Help up well and collapses well. A little pricey, but worth it if you intend to use it!
item.title: Very nice Trailer

item.body: It was a tough battle between the Fox Union Boa and Shimano's GE-9,  but i opted for the 2 boa system and I am not disappointed.  Still stiff enough for efficiency on long climbs yet comfy and planted on the decents.  Been on a few 15-20 mile rides in corner canyon trails (Utah) and haven't had any issues with slop or hot spots.  The 2 boa system allows  you nail the upper and lower section adjustment independently.  I also like the micro release system, so dial em a little tight, then just back em off slightly for the perfect fit.  Best of all, they don't look like the ole skinny MTB shoes.
item.title: Comfortable right our of the box
